reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Namibia - TB/HIV - Ministry of Health and Social Services of Namibia

description.narrative: Namibia - TB/HIV - Ministry of Health and Social Services of Namibia - MOH. This program has the following goals: To reduce new HIV infections and AIDS related mortality by 75% by 2022 from 2015 levels, and move towards ending AIDS as a public health threat by 2030. To reduce the national burden of TB by achieving fewer than ten TB patients per 100,000 population by 2019. The objectives of this program are: To reduce new HIV infections by 75% by 2020. To reduce HIV related deaths by 75% by 2020. To enroll and retain 100% of newly identified PLHIV on ART by 2020. To reduce TB/HIV co-infection rates. To accelerate the appropriate detection and diagnosis of TB. To manage all forms of TB, among all ages and including drug-resistant and drug-sensitive TB, including complications
